question: Students of 2nd-year MBBS are given a slide of the pancreas for study. The endocrine part shows islets of Langerhans with different types of cells. What cells of the pancreas secrete pancreatic polypeptide?
An old lady living alone has locked her room door, but she keeps checking whether the door is locked or not every 5 minutes. Which of the following conditions is she most likely to be suffering from?

A 38-year-old woman presents to the clinic with a history of end-stage renal disease secondary to hypertension. She has undergone dialysis 3 times weekly for the last 5 years and her medical records show progressive elevation of calcium levels over the last year. On physical examination, Body Mass Index (BMI) is 22.5 kg/m², blood pressure (BP) is 145/98 mmHg, and pulse rate is 91 beats/min. Laboratory test results: total calcium= 11.9 mg/dL (8.2-10 .2 mg/dL), phosphorus= 6.7 mg/dL (2.3-4.7 mg/dL), creatinine = 9.3 mg/dL (0.6-1.1 mg/dL), alkaline phosphatase = 1181 U/L (50-120 U/L). What is the most likely cause of her hypercalcemia?
The anti-inflammatory effects of glucocorticoids are due to which fundamental mechanism?

answers.option: Inhibit leukotriene and prostaglandin synthesis via inhibition of phospholipase A2
Simulate histamine release from mast cells

question: A drug addict keeps scratching his body and complains that he feels insects creeping on his body. What is he suffering from?

A patient presents with weakness, easy fatigability, gastrointestinal disturbances, and hyperpigmentation. Features are suggestive of adrenal insufficiency. What should be the time of sample collection for adrenal insufficiency?
What is the most common side effect of biosynthetic growth hormone?
Why is dexamethasone preferred in cerebral edema?

answers.option: It does not retain much sodium and water

question: Which snake venom causes rhabdomyolysis?
Sulfonylureas are a drug of choice for which of the following?
A patient reports to the psychiatry ward with a firm belief that somebody wants to kill him. What is this type of delusion called?
Strychnine is known to hyper-stimulate the motor nervous system in the anterior horn cells of the spinal cord. What is the mechanism of action of strychnine?

answers.option: Blocks glycine uptake at neuromuscular junction

question: A 56-year-old man was taking medications for osteoporosis secondary to hyperparathyroidism and recently was diagnosed with osteosarcoma. Which of the following medications he must be using?
Which of the following is true regarding the effect of radioiodine on the thyroid parenchyma?

answers.option: Alpha particles destroy the follicular cells
Gamma radiation destroys the parafollicular cells
Radioiodine has no effect on the thyroid parenchyma
Both alpha particles and gamma rays destroy the parafollicular cells
Beta radiations mainly destroy the follicular cell

question: A 56-year-old female patient who has a history of diabetes and hypertension starts taking amiodarone after her coronary artery bypass surgery. Later, she presents with symptoms of tiredness, sensitivity to cold, weight gain, and constipation. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 42-year-old man presents with polyuria and polydipsia for the past 4 months. On physical examination, there are no specific findings. Laboratory findings include serum Na+ 155 mol/L (high); K+ 3.9 mol/L; Cl- 111 mmol/L; CO2 27 mmol/L; glucose 84 mg/dL; creatinine 1 mg/dL. The specific gravity of urine is 1.002 (low). Which of the following is most likely to be deficient in this patient?

A 40-year-old woman notices that her gloves from the previous winter do not fit her hands. Her friends remark that her facial features have changed in the past year and that her voice seems deeper. On physical examination, she is afebrile. Her blood pressure is 140/90 mm Hg. She has coarse facial features. Examination of the foot shows an increased amount of soft tissue beneath the calcaneus. Which of the following statements is most appropriate for her condition?

A middle-aged man always remains dirty. He always complains about hearing some voices saying Mr. ABC is against you. What is the false perception of something in the absence of an external stimuli called?
A false belief that a person has which cannot be corrected is called?

While picking cotton from cotton pods, a farmer's wife develops nausea and dyspnea. When brought to the hospital, she is diagnosed with organophosphate poisoning. Which of the following is the most likely route of entry of the poison?
To differentiate between true and feigned insanity, a medical officer will notice that a truly insane patient:

answers.option: Has facial expressions that do not match with emotions

question: A 25-year-old man was traveling by train when he was offered a samosa with a cup of tea by a fellow passenger. After an hour he became aggressive and started talking irrelevantly and picking thread from his clothes. On examination, he was found to have dilated pupils, dysarthria, dry hot skin, and drunken gait. What is the poison responsible for this man's presentation?

A 25-year-old addict was spraying insecticide in the fields for the last three hours when he suddenly developed shortness of breath and cough. On examination he was found to have miosis, lacrimation, and salivation. What is the antidote of this poison?
Absorbed poison can be removed by?

A male patient of 50 years of age was diagnosed as a case of hyperthyroidism. The treating physician suggested him an anti-thyroid drug. Which of the following drugs inhibits the organification step of thyroid hormone synthesis?

A 60-year-old female with multinodular goiter is scheduled for a near total thyroidectomy. Which of the drugs will be administered for 10-14 days before surgery to reduce the vascularity of her thyroid gland?

A 40-year-old woman presents with an increasing feeling of fullness in her neck for the past 7 months. On physical examination, her thyroid gland is enlarged and nodular. A fine needle aspiration biopsy of the thyroid is done, and she undergoes thyroidectomy. Gross examination of the thyroid shows a multicentric thyroid neoplasm; microscopically, the neoplasm is composed of polygonal to spindle-shaped cells forming nests and trabeculae. There is a prominent, pink hyaline stroma. Which of the following immunohistochemical stains is most likely to be useful in the diagnosis of this neoplasm?
A 29-year-old female has a TSH of 13.5 mlU/L (normal: 0.5 to 4.7 mlU/L). Which of the following agents is most appropriate to treat this TSH abnormality?

A 44-year-old man sees his physician because of a ''lump'' on the left side of his neck. Physical examination shows a non-tender nodule on the left lobe of the thyroid gland. A cervical node is also enlarged and non-tender. Laboratory studies show no thyroid autoantibodies in his serum, and the T4 and TSH levels are normal. A thyroidectomy is performed. High-power microscopic examination of the thyroid shows Orphan Annie eye nuclei, nuclear grooves, and psammoma bodies. Which of the following is most likely to contribute to the development of the thyroid nodule in this patient?

This medication is used to treat hyperparathyroidism in patients with chronic renal failure. It works by mimicking the role of calcium in the blood and tricks the parathyroid gland into stopping the secretion of parathyroid hormone (PTH). Which of the following medications matches with this description?
Which of the following is the most common side effect of insulin therapy in type 1 diabetic patients?

A 14-year-old boy with type 1 diabetes is brought to the hospital complaining of dizziness. Laboratory findings show severe hypoglycemia and ketoacidosis. Which of the following drugs should be administered to achieve rapid control of severe ketoacidosis?

A 73-year-old woman presents with complaints of fatigue, sluggishness, weight gain, cold intolerance, dry skin, and muscle weakness for the last 2 months. When initiating T4 therapy for an elderly patient with long-standing hypothyroidism, small doses are administered in the beginning. This is done to avoid which of the following?

A 23-year-old woman has a routine health status examination. Her body mass index is 22. Laboratory studies show fasting plasma glucose is 120 mg/dL. Urinalysis shows mild glucosuria, but no ketonuria or proteinuria. She has no detectable insulin autoantibodies. Her father was similarly affected at age 20. She is most likely to have a mutation in a gene encoding for which of the following?

A professor wants to award a prize to his students on their remarkable performance in the exam. There were five students who are tied for the first position while the professor had to choose only one student among the 5. Which of the following would be a fair technique, which will help the professor choose one out of the five eligible students?

A researcher wants to select an unbiased sample, which will account for the various ethnicities residing in the area. Which of the following techniques will help the professor to recruit such a sample?

A professor was giving a lecture on the significance of sample size estimation. He emphasized that a large sample size will help to find whether the difference between two or more groups exists in reality. Which of the following was the professor referring to?

A researcher wants to select an unbiased national-level sample, which will account for the various ethnicities residing in Pakistan. He received a milllion dollar grant to find out the prevalence of hemoglobinopathies in Pakistan. Which of the following techniques will help the professor recruit such a sample?

A group of medical students submits the plan for their research project to the institutional board. This plan contains background, objectives, hypothesis, methodology, consent form, questionnaire, and references. Which of the following best defines this plan for research given in the above scenario?

A group of researchers write a research proposal and in it they gave an explanation of the fundamental reasons for their research. Which of the following best describes the justification of the research work?

A 6-month-old infant is brought to the outpatient department with by his parents with concerns about his general health. According to them, he was born at term at home with good weight and length but had a history of prolonged jaundice. Now they feel he is not active; he sleeps more and feeds less. There is also a history of constipation. On examination, the anterior fontanelle is open and large and the posterior fontanelle is still open. Which is the most likely investigation that will help in the diagnosis?

A 13-year-old girl presented with her parents with complaints of rapid decreased in her weight. According to the parents she has also complain of tremulousness, headache, mood disturbances, behavioral swings, difficulties with sleep, decrease in attention span, hyperactivity and a decline in school performance. On examination her eyes are protruded with lid lag. Her skin is smooth and flushed with excessive sweating. She is tachycardic with increased systolic blood pressure and a widened pulse pressure. What should be the treatment of choice to treat her underlying condition?
During embryogenesis of the pituitary gland, Rathke's pouch will lead to the formation of which of the following structures of the pituitary gland?

A 30-year-old woman complains of increasing weight gain, fatigability, depression and poor memory for last three months. She is noticed to have a pale complexion, dry scaly skin and high blood pressure. What is the most important investigation you will advise?
In case of untreated, primary hypothyroidism, the thyroid function tests best correspond to which of the following?

answers.option: Increased free T4, Decreased TSH, Decreased T3
Increased free T4, Decreased TSH, Increased T3
Decreased free T4, Increased TSH, Decreased T3
Decreased free T4, Decreased or normal TSH, Decreased T3
Increased free T4, Increased TSH, Increased reversed T3

question: When considering thyroid hormone replacement in case of primary hypothyroidism, which of the following precautions should be remembered?

answers.option: Thyroxine tablet needs to be taken empty stomach in the morning
Thyroxine should be stopped as soon as person becomes euthyroid
Thyroid hormone needs to be replaced for three months
Thyroid hormone pill should be taken with breakfast
Elderly people should be started at a higher doses of thyroxine

question: A 66-year-old woman is complaining of abdominal pain, constipation and polyuria. In the past, she underwent renal stone surgery. On examination, her blood pressure is 145/77mmHg and pulse is 98/min. Her fasting glucose and kidney function are normal but her calcium is found to be elevated at 13.05 mg/dL (NR 8.5-11.0). What is the most likely cause of her symptoms?

A 26-year-old woman is complaining of abnormal tingling sensation in her hands and feet. For the last 2 years, a neurologist has been treating her for seizure disorder. On, examination, her blood pressure is 125/77mmHg and pulse is 98/min. Her investigations show: Calcium= 6.5 (7.5-8.5 mg/dl) Phosphate = 4.8 (2.5-4.0 mg/dl). What investigation will you do?

A 40-year-old female with occasional complaints of dysuria and polyuria, presents with body aches and fatigue and the following labs: PTH 103 pg/ml (10-65), Ca 8.2 mg/dl (8.5-10.0), Phosphate 4.0 mmol/L (2.5-5.0), Albumin 4.4 mg/dl (2.5-5.5), Alkaline phosphatase 243 mg/dl (< 125), Vitamin D 8.0 ng/mL (> 30), 1,25 hydroxyvitamin D 7.0 pg/ml (18-78). What is the most likely cause of her condition?

A 30-year-old woman presents to the outpatient clinic with palpitations, weight loss and excessive sweating for almost 5-6 months. She cannot concentrate on carrying out her daily activities especially looking after her children. Recently, she has also developed pain in both eyes and her friend told her that one of her eyes has become more prominent than the other. What is the most likely cause of her condition?

A 22-year-old male presents to the clinic with weight loss, diarrhea, and tremors for 2 months. He complains of excessive sweating and palpitations whenever he commutes to his office in the morning. He smokes 1 pack of cigarettes per day. He later suffers from Hashimoto's thyroiditis. His primary physician orders the following labs and refers him to you. TSH: 0.002 mIU/L (0.4-2). Serum T4: 23.8 ng/ml (6.5-11.5). What is the interpretation of his lab results?

A 33-year-old woman presents with a lump in front of her neck. She is also giving history of on & off abdominal pain, and recurrent bilateral kidney stones. On examination, the size of lump is 2 x 2 cm. After complete investigations, she is diagnosed having parathyroid adenoma in one of parathyroid glands. Which of the following statements is correct regarding her management of primary hyperparathyroidism secondary to parathyroid adenoma?

answers.option: Excision and auto-transplantation gland in posterior triangle of neck
Excision of parathyroid adenoma gland only
Excision and auto-transplantation of gland at cubital fossa
Excision and auto-transplantation of one gland in popliteal fossa

question: A 21-year-old healthy male presents with history of on & off abdominal pain, recurrent bilateral kidney stones, and femur bone deformity. His blood reports show increased levels of PTH and increased blood calcium levels. After a complete workup, he is diagnosed with hyperplasia of all four parathyroid glands. Which of the following statements is best regarding his management of hyperplasia of all four glands?

answers.option: Excision of all four glands and auto-transplantation of gland or portion of gland at cubital fossa
Excision of any three parathyroid gland and leave one glands as such
Excision of all four parathyroid glands only
Excision of all four gland and leave portion of parathyroid gland at same site

question: A 27-year-old female undergoes total thyroidectomy for multinodular goiter. During this operation, the inferior thyroid artery is ligated. Which of the following nerves is intimately related to this artery?

A 35-year-old woman presents with complaints of feeling of fullness in her neck but has no other complaints. The enlargement has been gradual and painless for more than 1 year. Physical examination confirms diffuse enlargement of the thyroid gland without any apparent masses. Laboratory studies of thyroid function show a normal free T4 level and a slightly increased TSH level. What is the most likely cause of these findings?

An 8-year-old male is brought to the clinic by his parents concerned about his short stature compared to his peers. The parents mention a family history of late bloomers, with both parents having experienced a growth spurt in their later teen years. The patient's growth velocity is within normal limits, and he has no other concerning medical history. On physical examination, he has appropriate secondary sexual characteristics for his age. What is the most likely diagnosis of patient's short stature?

A 23-year-old, previously healthy woman died suddenly after complaining of a mild sore throat the previous day. At autopsy, her adrenal glands are enlarged, and there are extensive bilateral cortical hemorrhages. Which of the following organisms best accounts for these findings?

A 73-year-old woman has noticed a 10-kg weight loss in the past 3 months. She is becoming increasingly lethargic and has constant vague epigastric pain, nausea, and episodes of bloating and diarrhea. There is mild tenderness to palpation in the upper abdomen, but bowel sounds are present. Her stool is negative for occult blood. Laboratory findings include a total serum bilirubin concentration of 11.6 mg/dL and a direct bilirubin level of 10.6 mg/dL. Which of the following conditions involving the pancreas is most likely to be present?

A 62-year-old man has been concerned about a gradual weight gain over the past 30 years. He is 174 cm (5 ft 7 inches) tall and weighs 91 kg (body mass index 30 kg/m²). He is taking no medications. On physical examination, he has decreased sensation to pinprick and light touch over the lower extremities. Patellar reflexes are reduced. Motor strength seems to be normal in all extremities. Laboratory studies show glucose of 269 mg/dL, creatinine of 1.9 mg/dL, total cholesterol of 220 mg/dL, HDL cholesterol of 27 mg/dL, and triglycerides of 261 mg/dL. A chest radiograph shows mild cardiomegaly. Five years later, he has claudication in the lower extremities when he exercises. Based on these findings, which of the following complications in lower limbs can occur in this patient?

A 27-year-old woman experienced sudden severe abdominal pain. On physical examination, she had marked abdominal tenderness and guarding. Laboratory studies showed serum glucose, 76 mg/dL; calcium, 12.2 mg/dL, and parathyroid hormone, 62 pg/mL (normal range 9 to 60 pg/mL). During surgery, four enlarged parathyroid glands were found and excised, with reimplantation of one-half of one gland. After the surgery, her serum calcium concentration returned to normal. Three years later, she had an episode of upper gastrointestinal hemorrhage. Abdominal MRI indicated multiple 1- to 2-cm mass lesions in the pancreas. Two years later, she now has galactorrhea. Which of the following lesions is now most likely to be present?

answers.option: Small-cell anaplastic carcinoma of the lung

question: Where is the pituitary gland present relative to the optic chiasm?
The histological section of neurohypophysis shows supporting cells and axons with dilated terminal ends. What are the supporting cells and dilated terminal ends of axons called?
Which of the following radioactive rays would most effectively destroy the parenchyma of the thyroid gland?
A patient is diagnosed with hyperparathyroidism. Which of the following would be the way to detect which glands are the source of the problem?
A patient with a history of diabetes mellitus presented with twitching of the face on one side only. Which of the following would be the most appropriate diagnosis?
A 72-year-old male patient was recently diagnosed with hyperparathyroidism. His calcium is 13.2 mg/dl. Which of the following other abnormality would be seen in this patient?

A 60-year-old woman has felt a “lump” on the right side of her neck for several months. On physical examination, she has a firm 3 cm mass in the right lobe of the thyroid gland. There is no palpable lymphadenopathy. Laboratory studies show a serum TSH level of 3 mU/L and a T4 level of 8.8 µg/dL. A fine-needle aspiration biopsy is done, and she undergoes a thyroidectomy. A 3-cm solid mass is present within the right thyroid lobe. Six months later, she visited her physician again because of pain in the right thigh. A radiograph shows a fracture of the right femur in an area of lytic bone destruction. A radioiodine scan shows uptake localized to the region of the fracture. Which of the following was most likely to have been present in the patient's thyroid gland?

A 25-year-old woman has noted breast secretions for the past month. She is not breastfeeding and has never been pregnant. She has not menstruated for the past 5 months. Physical examination yields no abnormal findings. MRI of the brain shows a 0.7-cm mass in the adenohypophysis. Which of the following additional complications is most likely to be present in this patient?
Which of the following is true about exenatide?

answers.option: It acts on the calcium channels

question: A patient presented with complaints of weakness and fatigue. The BP is 90/60 and the RBS is 50mg/dl on examination. On further inquiry, she reveals that she has postural hypotension. Which of the following would be the most appropriate test to diagnose this condition?

answers.option: CT scan of adrenals and pituitary

question: A woman presented with symptoms of hyperthyroidism. On stretching her hands, there were tremors and warm and sweaty hands. Bilateral proptosis was also present. On labs, TSH was high, and thyroxine was high. Which of the following would be the most likely diagnosis?
A 60-year-old patient was diagnosed with a toxic thyroid adenoma. Which of the following is the best treatment for this patient?

100 cancer patients were divided into two groups. One group was given chemotherapy while the other was given medications plus chemotherapy. This is an example of which of the following types of research?

Qualitative data cannot be divided into quantitative data like x and y groups and hence a correlation cannot be established. For example, the frequency of male smokers to female smokers. Which of the following can be used to assess such data?

To conduct a study on the cleanliness of operation theatres, researchers chose 1 out of 4 city districts. Out of that district they chose 5 out of 20 hospitals and visited them. Which of the following research methods did they use?

A patient came in with buffalo hump, moon facies, and abdominal striae. The MRI showed an increase in the size of the pituitary gland. Which of the following is the single best diagnostic test for this condition?

answers.option: ACTH levels from Inferior petrosal sinus sampling

question: For the P value to be <0.05, which hypothesis is rejected?
Which of the following true regarding sitagliptin?

answers.option: It is a highly selective DPP-4 inhibitor
Can be used in people from all ages

question: To conduct a study, researchers dug out the records of students from Oxford University. They found all the previous data and death certificates to find the mortality rate. What type of study is this?
Which of the following true regarding meglinitides?

answers.option: Close calcium channels to cause insulin release
Open potassium channels to cause insulin release

question: A child suffers from growth hormone deficiency. Which of the following is the best indicator?
A research study stated, "To assess the prevalence of anemia in Pakistan." Which of the following could this statement be best defined as?
A group of students conducting research did not ask for consent of the participants. Which of the following medical ethics did they violate?
In a research questionnaire, a question asked, "How has your university experience been?" There were no options given and the students could write anything they wanted. What kind of question is this?
In which of the following conditions is T3 preferred over T4?
Which of the following primarily mediates the pharmacological effect of growth hormone?
Which of the following is used to calculate the sample size for a study?

A patient presented with complaints of headache, sweating, and palpitations. During an episode of the headache, her blood pressure rises to 150/70. Which of the following would be most likely found in this patient?
A class was shown a histological slide that had three distinct cell layers but all had abundant smooth endoplasmic reticulum. Which of the following organs could it be?
Which of the following laboratory investigations would be found in a lung small cell carcinoma?
A bronchoscopy of a patient reveals a lung small cell carcinoma. Which of the following would be raised in this patient?
An abdominal CT scan of a patient showed calcification in the pancreas. Which of the following would be raised in this patient?
A patient presented with a lump-like swelling on the neck. The imaging showed a cystic lesion in the thyroid of the patient. Which of the following is the best management?
Which type of cells are found centrally in the pancreas?
